goals.question: What is the relationship between x and y in each dataset?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of x and y for each dataset
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the correlation between x and y in each dataset and identify any patterns or outliers.

goals.question: How do the summary statistics of x and y compare across the four datasets?
goals.visualization: Box plot of x and y for each dataset
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us compare the central tendency, spread, and skewness of x and y across the four datasets.

goals.question: What is the relationship between x and y in each dataset after removing outliers?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of x and y for each dataset with outliers removed
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the correlation between x and y in each dataset after removing any outliers that may be skewing the data.

goals.question: How do the regression lines for x and y compare across the four datasets?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of x and y for each dataset with regression line
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us compare the slope, intercept, and goodness of fit of the regression lines for x and y across the four datasets.

goals.question: What is the distribution of x and y in each dataset?
goals.visualization: Histogram of x and y for each dataset
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the shape, central tendency, and spread of the distributions of x and y in each dataset.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.set(style="ticks")
    sns.lmplot(x="x", y="y", col="dataset", hue="dataset", data=data,
               col_wrap=2, ci=None, palette="muted", height=4,
               scatter_kws={"s": 50, "alpha": 1})
    plt.subplots_adjust(top=0.8)
    plt.suptitle("What is the relationship between x and y in each dataset?")
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.set(style="ticks")
    sns.boxplot(x="dataset", y="x", data=data, palette="Set3")
    plt.title("How do the summary statistics of x and y compare across the four datasets?", wrap=True)
    sns.boxplot(x="dataset", y="y", data=data, palette="Set3")
    plt.title("How do the summary statistics of x and y compare across the four datasets?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.dropna()
    sns.set(style="ticks")
    sns.lmplot(x="x", y="y", col="dataset", hue="dataset", data=data, col_wrap=2, ci=None, palette="muted", scatter_kws={"s": 50, "alpha": 1})
    plt.subplots_adjust(top=0.8)
    plt.suptitle("What is the relationship between x and y in each dataset after removing outliers?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.set(style="ticks")
    sns.lmplot(x="x", y="y", col="dataset", hue="dataset", data=data,
               col_wrap=2, ci=None, palette="muted", height=4,
               scatter_kws={"s": 50, "alpha": 1})
    plt.subplots_adjust(top=0.8)
    plt.suptitle("How do the regression lines for x and y compare across the four datasets?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.set(style="whitegrid")
    g = sns.FacetGrid(data, col="dataset", hue="dataset", col_wrap=2, height=4)
    g.map(sns.histplot, "x", alpha=.7)
    g.map(sns.histplot, "y", alpha=.7)
    g.fig.subplots_adjust(top=0.8)
    g.fig.suptitle('What is the distribution of x and y in each dataset?')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
